body_html:
This is what I have so far:
gdeer81@5275fc4

It took a bit of fiddling to get the test to go from erroring out to just plain failing. Using the x_fn variable like the other tests do just caused a seg fault so I commented it out and just started plugging in random values for the second arg to the test method. The only acceptable value so far has been 0.

But the test output doesn't say why the test failed so I'm kind of at a loss for how to write a proper test for this one despite all the examples whose test inputs look arbitrary and don't really provide any helpful information to anyone who is trying to write new tests.

body:
This is what I have so far:
https://github.com/gdeer81/tensorflow/commit/5275fc4dfd584ea3e95ea5227259c4e9d36d2f13

It took a bit of fiddling to get the test to go from erroring out to just plain failing. Using the x_fn variable like the other tests do just caused a seg fault so I commented it out and just started plugging in random values for the second arg to the test method. The only acceptable value so far has been 0.

But the test output doesn't say why the test failed so I'm kind of at a loss for how to write a proper test for this one despite all the examples  whose test inputs look arbitrary and don't really provide any helpful information to anyone who is trying to write new tests.
